thread.title: Plantation passes Dillard test as playoffs loom
thread.title_full: Plantation passes Dillard test as playoffs loom

author: Patrick Maks
title: Plantation passes Dillard test as playoffs loom
text:
Patrick Maks Contact Reporter South Florida Sun-Sentinel Week 9: @PHScolonels pass test at @DILLARDFTBALL as playoffs loom 
Trailing 21-14 and facing a 3rd-and-51, Anthony "Mo" Hasan rolled to his left, desperately trying to evade defenders. 
Then Dillard's senior quarterback planted his feet, set his hips and tried to launch a pass to resuscitate Dillard's hopes of mounting one final drive at home in the game's waning minutes. 
But it was too late. 
Dillard fell 23-14 after Plantation swarmed Hasan in his own end zone for a safety with 1:02 to play in the fourth quarter, dashing the Panthers' comeback hopes and a chance to earn a signature win. 
Instead, the Colonels (7-2) claimed a gritty victory with postseason looming. With Flanagan's win over Cypress Bay on Friday night, the Falcons tied up the District 12-8A title and helped Plantation clinch a playoff berth as runner-up.
